c74object.name: spat5.quat.fromvectors
c74object.description: spat5.quat.fromvectors creates a quaternion representing the rotation between two 3D vectors.

attribute.name: initwith
attribute.description:
The initwith attribute can be used to specify the initial state of the object. You should provide a list of comma-separated OSC commands. The list of messages should be quoted (with double quote character "). This is similar to sending the list of commands via loadbang or loadmess.
Have a look at the spat5.tuto-osc-3.maxpat example for further details.
Note that the initwith attribute cannot be set via message, attrui or inspector; it must be typed directly within the object box.

method.name: /post/version
method.description: print the version in the Max Console.

method.name: /post/version
method.description: print detailed version in the Max Console.

method.name: /post/doc
method.description: print the help documentation in the Max Console.

method.name: /post/state
method.description: print the OSC status in the Max Console.

method.name: /preset/load
method.description: load a preset from file. Supported file extensions : '.txt' for human-readable OSC text file, '.osc' for binary encoded OSC file, '.coll' for human-readable Max coll file (compatible with the coll object). '.txt' is the default file format. You can specify the fullpath of the file, or only its filename if the file is inside Max search path.

method.name: /preset/load
method.description: open a user dialog to load a preset file. Supported file extensions : '.txt' for human-readable OSC text file, '.osc' for binary encoded OSC file, '.coll' for human-readable Max coll file (compatible with the coll object). '.txt' is the default file format.

method.name: /preset/export
method.description: export a preset to file. Supported file extensions : '.txt' for human-readable OSC text file, '.osc' for binary encoded OSC file, '.coll' for human-readable Max coll file (compatible with the coll object). '.txt' is the default file format. If the file extension is not provided, '.txt' will be used by default. If the destination folder is not provided, the file will be saved in your home folder (/Users/yourlogin).

method.name: /preset/export
method.description: open a user dialog to export a preset to file. Supported file extensions : '.txt' for human-readable OSC text file, '.osc' for binary encoded OSC file, '.coll' for human-readable Max coll file (compatible with the coll object). '.txt' is the default file format.

method.name: /status
method.description: open the status window and bring it to front.

method.name: /status/open
method.description: open the status window and bring it to front.

method.name: /status/close
method.description: close the status window.

method.name: /status/openorclose
method.description: open the status window if it was closed; close it if it was opened.

method.name: /status/font/size
method.description: set the font size of the status window.

method.name: /status/floating
method.description: make the status window 'floating' (i.e. always on top of other windows).

method.name: /help
method.description: open the help window and bring it to front.

method.name: /help/open
method.description: open the help window and bring it to front.

method.name: /help/close
method.description: close the help window.

method.name: /help/openorclose
method.description: open the help window if it was closed; close it if it was opened.

method.name: /help/font/size
method.description: set the font size of the help window.

method.name: /help/floating
method.description: make the help window 'floating' (i.e. always on top of other windows).

method.name: /snapshot
method.description: open the snapshot window and bring it to front.

method.name: /snapshot/open
method.description: open the snapshot window and bring it to front.

method.name: /snapshot/close
method.description: close the snapshot window.

method.name: /snapshot/openorclose
method.description: open the snapshot window if it was closed; close it if it was opened.

method.name: /snapshot/font/size
method.description: set the font size of the snapshot window.

method.name: /snapshot/floating
method.description: make the snapshot window 'floating' (i.e. always on top of other windows).

method.name: /status/copytoclipboard
method.description: copy the status to (the OS) clipboard.

method.name: /status/copytoclipboard
method.description: copy the status to (the OS) clipboard, and specify the end-of-line character (e.g. ',').

method.name: /dump
method.description: dump the complete state of the object over the rightmost outlet (a.k.a. dump outlet).

method.name: /dump
method.description: dump a subset of the state of the object over the rightmost outlet. See spat5.tuto-dump-1.maxpat for usage examples.

method.name: /snapshot/deleteall
method.description: delete all the snapshots currently in memory.

method.name: /snapshot/add
method.description: create a new snapshot with the current state.

method.name: /snapshot/add
method.description: create a new snapshot with the current state, and set its name.

method.name: /snapshot/[index]/store
method.description: store the current state in the i-th snapshot (in memory).

method.name: /snapshot/[index]/recall
method.description: recall the current state from the i-th snapshot.

method.name: /snapshot/[index]/jump
method.description: immediately recall the current state from the i-th snapshot (ignoring recall time).

method.name: /snapshot/[index]/name
method.description: set the name of the i-th snapshot.

method.name: /snapshot/interpolate
method.description: interpolate between the i-th and j-th snapshots.

method.name: /snapshot/interpolate
method.description: interpolate between two snapshots, given their names.

method.name: /snapshot/[index]/delete
method.description: delete the i-th snapshot.

method.name: /snapshot/[index]/copytoclipboard
method.description: copy the i-th snapshot to (the OS) clipboard.

method.name: /snapshot/[index]/copytoclipboard
method.description: copy the i-th snapshot to (the OS) clipboard, and specify the end-of-line character (e.g. ',').

method.name: /snapshot/[index]/export
method.description: export the i-th snapshot to file.

method.name: /snapshot/[index]/export/content
method.description: export the content of the i-th snapshot to file.

method.name: /snapshot/export
method.description: export all snapshots to file.

method.name: /snapshot/import
method.description: import all snapshots from file.

method.name: /snapshot/recall/next
method.description: recall the next snapshot.

method.name: /snapshot/recall/previous
method.description: recall the previous snapshot.

method.name: /snapshot/jump/next
method.description: immediately recall the next snapshot (ignoring recall time).

method.name: /snapshot/jump/previous
method.description: immediately recall the previous snapshot (ignoring recall time).

method.name: /snapshot/recall
method.description: recall the i-th snapshot.

method.name: /snapshot/jump
method.description: immediately recall the i-th snapshot (ignoring recall time).

method.name: /snapshot/recall/bytitle
method.description: recall a snapshot by title/name.

method.name: /snapshot/jump/bytitle
method.description: immediately recall a snapshot by title/name (ignoring recall time).

method.name: /snapshot/lock
method.description: lock edition of the snapshots.

method.name: /snapshot/renumber
method.description: renumber the snapshots (their OSC pattern) based on their position.

method.name: /snapshot/sort
method.description: sort the snapshots alphabetically (based on their titles).
